result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Gutierrez-Garnica

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angel Gutierrez-Garnica appeared by video.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia appeared by video for Angel Gutierrez-Garnica.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference.
Spanish interpreter did not appear/scheduled.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel Gutierrez-Garnica appeared by video.  Attorney Kristina M Cervera Garcia appeared by video for Angel Gutierrez-Garnica.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 086534,
Payable Number: 1031293,
Receipt Number: 22RP036338,
Amount: $20.00
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angel Gutierrez-Garnica in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/22/22 @ 2:30p
